title: Andrew Scott confirms 'exciting' Fleabag reunion with Phoebe Waller-Bridge
text:
The duo will be working together again – and we can’t wait. (Picture: David Fisher/BAFTA/REX)

It’s the news all Fleabag fans have been waiting for – TV’s hottest priest Andrew Scott has revealed he’s teaming up with fellow star Phoebe Waller-Bridge once again.

The man who became an unlikely sex god overnight told ES Magazine the exciting news as well as discussing his role in Fleabag, how he found acting and his love-hate relationship with Ireland and Catholicism.

The star didn’t give too much away about when he and Phoebe will be reuniting but he did reveal they have ‘exciting plans’.

He said: ‘We have plans to work together. She’s a total delight. I love her. We’ve got exciting plans afoot.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Andrew, who rose to fame playing villain Moriarty opposite Benedict Cumberbatch’s detective in Sherlock, said not only does he feel proud of Fleabag but America’s response to the series has been ‘incredible’.

He added: ‘It wasn’t just a storyline for shock value.

‘To see a priest who is a human being is important. To fall in love with somebody but to be married to the church — that’s a really interesting dilemma. I think more people of our generation would enter the church if they could have a love as well as a spiritual life.’

A Fleabag reunion is incoming (Picture: BBC/Getty)

On America’s response to Fleabag he said: ‘It was absolutely incredible, completely joyful. This is a six-part BBC3 show and you’re there with these monsters of American television. Phoebe said to me, “You’ve got to come to America because you see how much they really responded to the show.” And they really have. It was brilliant.’

Not only was the show a hit in American, but Fleabag also completely wiped the floor at this year’s 71st Primetime Emmys, picking up four gongs at the ceremony.

The hit BBC series took home the accolade for Best Comedy Series, with Phoebe winning Lead Actress in a Comedy Series and Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series, and Harry Bradbeer being named Outstanding Director for a Comedy series.

Andrew Scott is proud of his role in Fleabag and loves the feedbag from American fans

(Picture: ES Magazine)

Despite the exciting news of a reunion, Fleabag fans may have to wait for the next series as Phoebe admitted that she has no plans of reprising the role before she turns 50.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Although Andrew has revealed that he’ll gladly come back to the show, no matter how long the wait is.

Speaking to Digital Spy about the thought of rejoining the show in over a decade, the 42-year-old actor joked: ‘Oh, I’ll probably be dead.’

However, he continued: ‘But if I’m still alive, yeah. Listen, I’ll be there, whatever she wants me to do.

‘I love the fact that that story was completely self-contained and beautiful,

‘I think sometimes when something is a success, you just want to elongate it for the wrong reasons.’

Fleabag is available to stream on BBC iPlayer.
